com.jom

Class Expression

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jom.Expression

  • public abstract class Expression
extends java.lang.Object
    Expressions objects represent a function of the decision variables defined in its related OptimizationProblem object. JOM creates Expression objects parsing Strings in the JOM syntax.
    Author:
    Pablo Pavon Mari√±o
    See Also:
    http://www.net2plan.com/jom

      Evaluates this expression, in the point provided by the decision variables.

      Evaluates the given cell in this expression.
      DoubleMatrix2D evaluateJacobian(java.lang.Object... varNameVarValuePairs)
      Evaluates the jacobian of this expression, in the point provided by the decision variables.
      OptimizationProblem getModel()
      Returns the optimization problem object that is the framework where this expression was created
      int getNumDim()
      Returns the number of dimensions in this expression
      int getNumScalarExpressions()
      Returns the number of cells (scalar expressions) inside this arrayed expression

      Returns true if the expression has two dimensions, and is a 1x1 expression (a scalar)

    • Method Detail

      • evaluateConstant

        public final DoubleMatrixND evaluateConstant()
        Evaluates this expression. The expression should be a constant: do not depend from the decision variables
        Returns:
        an array with the same size as the expression, with the values evaluated in each cell

      • evaluate

        public final DoubleMatrixND evaluate(java.lang.Object... varNameVarValuePairs)
        Evaluates this expression, in the point provided by the decision variables. For those variables for which value is not provided, zeros are assumed.
        Parameters:
        varNameVarValuePairs - An even number of parameters, first in each pair is a String with the variable name, second a DoubleMatrixND object with its value
        Returns:
        an array with the same size as the expression, with the values evaluated in each cell

      • evaluateConstant

        public final double evaluateConstant(int cellIndex)
        Evaluates the given cell in this expression. The expression should be a constant: do not depend from the decision variables
        Returns:
        an array with the same size as the expression, with the values evaluated in each cell

      • evaluateJacobian

        public final DoubleMatrix2D evaluateJacobian(java.lang.Object... varNameVarValuePairs)
        Evaluates the jacobian of this expression, in the point provided by the decision variables. For those variables for which value is not provided, zeros are assumed.
        Parameters:
        varNameVarValuePairs - An even number of parameters, first in each pair is a String with the variable name, second a DoubleMatrixND object with its value
        Returns:
        a DoubleMatrix2D array representing the jacobian matrix, with one row for each cell in the expression (in the position of its linear index), and one column per decision variable

      • getNumDim

        public final int getNumDim()
        Returns the number of dimensions in this expression
        Returns:
        the number of dimensions

      • getNumScalarExpressions

        public final int getNumScalarExpressions()
        Returns the number of cells (scalar expressions) inside this arrayed expression
        Returns:
        the number of cells

      • isScalar

        public final boolean isScalar()
        Returns true if the expression has two dimensions, and is a 1x1 expression (a scalar)
        Returns:
        true or false as stated above

      • size

        public final int[] size()
        Returns the size of the array. The size array produced is a copy.
        Returns:
        Array size. The i-th element in size indicates the size of the array in the corresponding dimension.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getModel

        public final OptimizationProblem getModel()
        Returns the optimization problem object that is the framework where this expression was created
        Returns:
        the optimization problem object
